      • instantiate

        public <T extends Resource> T instantiate(Class<T> clazz)
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Instantiates and returns a new instance of the specified Resource type. The instance is merely instantiated and is not saved/synchronized with the server in any way.

        This method effectively replaces the new keyword that would have been used otherwise if the concrete implementation was known (Resource implementation classes are intentionally not exposed to SDK end-users).

        Specified by:
        instantiate in interface DataStore
        Type Parameters:
        T - the Resource sub-type
        Parameters:
        clazz - the Resource class to instantiate.
        Returns:
        a new instance of the specified Resource.

      • instantiate

        public <T extends Resource> T instantiate(Class<T> clazz,
                                          Map<String,Object> properties)
        Specified by:
        instantiate in interface InternalDataStore

      • instantiate

        public <T extends Resource> T instantiate(Class<T> clazz,
                                          Map<String,Object> properties,
                                          boolean hrefFragment)
        Description copied from interface: InternalDataStore
        Instantiates and returns a new instance of the specified Resource type. The instance is merely instantiated and is not saved/synchronized with the server in any way. This operation allows the href to be a fragment, where the baseUrl can be missing and will be added automatically.
        Specified by:
        instantiate in interface InternalDataStore
        Type Parameters:
        T - the Resource sub-type
        Parameters:
        clazz - the Resource class to instantiate.
        properties - the properties the instantiated resource will have
        hrefFragment - when true, the baseUrl will be appended to the value found in the href key of the properties map. If false the href will not be altered and will be kept as-is.
        Returns:
        a resource instance corresponding to the specified clazz.

      • getResource

        public <T extends Resource> T getResource(String href,
                                          Class<T> clazz)
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Looks up (retrieves) the resource at the specified href URL and returns the resource as an instance of the specified class.

        The Class argument must represent an interface that is a sub-interface of Resource, for example Account, Directory, etc.

        Specified by:
        getResource in interface DataStore
        Type Parameters:
        T - type parameter indicating the returned value is a Resource instance.
        Parameters:
        href - the resource URL of the resource to retrieve
        clazz - the Resource sub-interface to instantiate
        Returns:
        an instance of the specified class based on the data returned from the specified href URL.

      • getResource

      • getResource

        public <T extends Resource> T getResource(String href,
                                          Class<T> clazz,
                                          Map<String,Object> queryParameters)
        Specified by:
        getResource in interface InternalDataStore

      • getResource

        public <T extends Resource,R extends T> R getResource(String href,
                                                      Class<T> parent,
                                                      String childIdProperty,
                                                      Map<String,Class<? extends R>> idClassMap)
        This method provides the ability to instruct the DataStore how to decide which class of a resource hierarchy will be instantiated. For example, nowadays three ProviderData resources exists (ProviderData, FacebookProviderData and GoogleProviderData). The childIdProperty is the property that will be used in the response as the ID to seek for the proper concrete ProviderData class in the idClassMap.
        Specified by:
        getResource in interface InternalDataStore
        Type Parameters:
        T - the root of the hierarchy of the Resource we want to instantiate.
        R - the sub-class of the root Resource.
        Parameters:
        href - the endpoint where the request will be targeted to.
        parent - the root class of the Resource hierarchy (helps to validate that the idClassMap contains subclasses of it).
        childIdProperty - the property whose value will be used to identify the specific class in the hierarchy that we need to instantiate.
        idClassMap - a mapping to be able to know which class corresponds to each childIdProperty value.
        Returns:
        the retrieved resource

      • getResource

        public <T extends Resource,O extends Options> T getResource(String href,
                                                            Class<T> clazz,
                                                            O options)
        Description copied from interface: DataStore
        Retrieves the resource at the specified href according to the specified Options and returns the resource as an instance of the specified clazz.
        Specified by:
        getResource in interface DataStore
        Type Parameters:
        T - type parameter indicating the returned value is a Resource instance.
        Parameters:
        href - the URL of the resource to retrieve
        clazz - the Resource sub-interface to instantiate
        options - the Options sub-interface with the properties to expand
        Returns:
        an instance of the specified class based on the data returned from the specified href URL.
